author: .vbuterin
content:
> the callee could cause OOG with other opcodes too

The callee can only cause OOG of themselves; the callee cannot cause the parent to bleed more gas than the parent allocated to the callee

author: .vbuterin
content: If we charge at time of execution, we preserve that invariant; if we charge later, than we sacrifice it

author: .vbuterin
content: because the callee can rack up a huge bill that the parent would have to pay for at the end of the transaction (and possibly lead to OOG of the whole tx)
